page.title: 06Ecology - Conservation
page.content: The upper Kent estuary is part of an unspoilt tidal river mouth and merits conservation for both scenic and scientific reasons. {Protective Bodies} The northern shore of the estuary and adjoining land are included in the Lake District National Park, and across the estuary is the Arnside/Silverdale AONB. The Natural History interests of the area are the concern of the Nature Conservancy Council with its northern headquarters at Windermere. {Nature Reserve}Meathop Moss, a raised bog scheduled as a Site of Special Scientific Interest, is managed by the Cumbria Trust for Nature Conservation. The abundant specialised plant and insect life depends upon waterlogged peaty soil. Trust volunteers work to prevent drying out and encroaching tree growth.
